website_summaries.verdict: The Linksys WRT400N Simultaneous Dual-N Band Wireless Router is a good option for your wireless network, thanks to its support of both 2.4Ghz and 5Ghz bands, its helpful software application, and a good set of networking features. The router's unimpressive 5Ghz throughput speed and lack of Gigabit and USB support are the only major knocks against it.
pros: good Web interface and software application
cons: Its 5Ghz throughput speed could be better

customer_reviews.title: Failed less than 2 years from date of purchase.
customer_reviews.text: It worked well enough initially, but became intermittent, needed frequent reset, and gradually the effective distance reduced until I could only connect if in the same room, within 4-5 ft, immediately after a re-boot. Customer support said it was out of warranty, so they couldn't talk me through set up. They did recommend updating the 'firmware' using directions on their site. I spent a great deal of time trying to work thru the instructions, but finally hit a point I could not get past, so never succeeded at firmware update. I did reinstall with the original cd and it worked like majic... for about 4 days, then it quickly faded. Failed too soon given the purchase price.
customer_reviews.author: jeanniej

customer_reviews.title: I guess it reboots itself less often than the old D-Link did
customer_reviews.text: This router does a fine job for very basic home wireless use - dual band is a nice feature if you have some older devices around. If you have a lot of devices (more than 5-6) it seems to sense a TPN (or something) and randomly reboots itself. Again, I have a couple of Roku devices, three or four laptops, a gaming device, an AT&T MicroCell and a handful of other handheld devices that all need to connect to my network - so maybe it is just getting confused trying to handle 10-15 devices. Unfortunately, this was $100 that was basically wasted - my old D-Link router did just as well/badly.....
customer_reviews.author: Tony W

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 years, Linksys has offered zero support on repairing the item without further payment
customer_reviews.text: This router worked great... until it suddenly stopped letting me access the internet. Linksys refused to even give me technical support unless I paid sixty dollars for "14 day free technical support". This is insane. What an awful company. I will never buy Lynksys again, especially because they called their sixty dollar "free" technical support "free". This product did not even last two years, and most router I have owned last forever. I will never buy a Linksys product again (or Cisco or whatever they are calling themselves). Please share this review, because this router cost hundreds of dollars that have now been wasted. Never again Linksys, I vow to spread how awful you are.
customer_reviews.author: G. E. Romero

customer_reviews.title: Ordered New, sent a refurbished product
customer_reviews.text: In ordering this, I ordered through Amazon (stated as being directly from Amazon.com) and I specifically ordered the slightly more expensive version that was NOT marked as refurbished. In troubleshooting with Cisco, they noted that the serial number was a refurbished product. I'm surprised Amazon did not mention this in anyway. I will be returning this and NOT ordering products like this again through Amazon. I expected more, Amazon. The wireless connection didn't work at all so, not even a very good refurbished product, either. I give this three stars as the product itself may be okay, but Amazon was NOT.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Kinney

customer_reviews.title: you can't register the software it's not supported anymore
customer_reviews.text: The reason I purchased this was the software that comes with it as well as I know Cisco makes a great product. The software was a total disappointment. You can't register it. They don't support it anymore. That's why it's 4 out of 5 and not 5 out of 5 stars. The router is working and does it's job. Can't as for anymore from the hardware.
customer_reviews.author: kim-berly

customer_reviews.title: Worst. Router. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this router for more than a year with Comcast modem, and always had problems with retrieving IP address from Comcast. It may get IP address one time, and then fail miserably the other time (computer gets IP address without any problems if directly connected to the Comcast modem, so Comcast connection is OK). I'm an IT professional with special interest in networking, so I've spent many hours trying to make the router work reliably: I've tried rebooting, MAC cloning, even using DD-WRT... - to no avail. So I'm giving up and going back to Old Faithful Linksys WRT54GL.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: This is the ONE!!!
customer_reviews.text: We have had this router for about a month now and we have had no problems with it at all. Range is very good. We have it in the basement we do all of our laptop and iPods upstairs and we have not had one connection problem so far. With our last router we were ALWAYS pushing the reset button sometimes 3 to 6 times a day. A real pain so you can imagine how pleased we are to have purchsed this router. Recommended highly and as always Amazon was right on with shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Keeper of Time

customer_reviews.title: A really good router
customer_reviews.text: I've had issues with not retaining reliable connections to my laptop with other routers as I moved from room to room. This router has been much more reliable. However, be sure to install it in a central location in the house, and if it is down stairs, place it as high as possible in the room. That seems to improve the range. We run 2 laptops and 2 connected BR-DVDs off of it and are able to stream movies and other content wirelessly over the internet with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: DMoreland

customer_reviews.title: Fast, reliable connections
customer_reviews.text: If you haven't upgraded our router in a few years, then it is definitely worth buying this router. Much faster and more reliable connections. Not sure if we really needed the dual-band but my husband liked having the option in case our media usage increased. Set up process was OK -- took a few tries to get my laptop to find the router which was a little frustrating, but altogether, took less than an hour to get everything up and running which is not bad.
customer_reviews.author: cinders

customer_reviews.title: SUPER!
customer_reviews.text: THIS PRODUCT IS BETTER THAN WHAT I WAS EXPECTING. SIMPLE ENOUGH INSTRUCTIONS TO SETUP, EVEN FOR SOMEONE AS 14.4 AS I AM. WHAT SHOCKED ME MORE THAN ANYTHING IS FINDING OUT HOW MUCH SPEED I WAS MISSING FROM MY PREVIOUS ROUTER. I LOVE RUNNING THE SPEED TEST. THE WIRED CONNECTIONS JUST SHOT LIKE A BULLIT. THE WIRELESS CONNECTIONS STILL MANAGED TO DOWNLOAD AS GOOD OR BETTER THAN MY OTHER WIRED ROUTER DID(AVERAGE 6 Mbps ON SPEED TEST) I AM A HAPPY CAMPER.
customer_reviews.author: BIG  DADDYRICH

customer_reviews.title: Good hardware ... poor software
customer_reviews.text: The router comes with the EasyLink Advisor, which still isn't working correctly on my computer after two re-loads. The control buttons on the advisor only display when I hover my cursor over where the buttons should be. No on-line help. I'm using Vista, but Vista and EasyLink have both been out long enough for this kind of problem to have been resolved. The router works great and the advisor isn't necessary, so I still think it's a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Really Don't know
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with great hope's but I have to say that I have really had a lot of problems since getting it and Customer service for cisco-linksys really is terrible and so is tech support. Shop around. I really go by reviews of other customers and that is why I went with this product. Thats not saying others have had great experiences with it. I just have really regreted getting it.YMMV!
customer_reviews.author: Stevec316

customer_reviews.title: It's Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased it some time ago and still working strong, 11/22/12. There is a model above this one but, there really isn't any need for it for home usage. This one manages up to 8 devices simultaneously with no problems of speed slowing down. Great for steaming movies! There has been a change in model numbers since then so, I'd highly recommend the one that replaced this older version.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I just replaced a LinkSys G with this WRT400N. What an amazing difference! I'm using my home wireless network for both computer connectivity and TIVO uploads/transfers. Before, with the G, I was getting 6 bars on the Netflix quality meter; now I'm getting 10 out of 10! and the picture/sound quality is great. It even has to go through a floor/ceiling and a couple of walls! Computer network speed is equally impressive. Setup was a snap and the included software has some very nice features. I couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Douglas A. Drake

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Set was a breeze. The software that came with the unit was easy to install and very intuitive. The signal is really strong compared to the old cisco router that was DD WRT'd. The signal strength was 3 bars on the DD WRT modified cisco router vs full bar with this N router. The difference is obvious and this really is a product worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Edgar H. Tan, MD

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: Got this in lieu of the E3200. Had trouble connecting on the 5GHZ frequency band with the E3200 which was priced $130+, was skeptical downgrading to the WRT400N however could not be happier with the choice. Am streaming HDX movies on my InternetTV w/out any buffering ON THE 5ghz band,my computers are connected at 2X speed vs. the WRT54G router I had for the past 3 yrs. Hope this technology is relevant for at least another 3yrs!
customer_reviews.author: S. Rajan

customer_reviews.title: Solid Router
customer_reviews.text: This router performs great. I did not use the provided CD to install, it only seemed to be extra junk that wasn't necessary (638mb for network configuration?!) But was easy enough to setup just using the default 192.168.1.1 method. Dual Band is great, as a lot of different types of machines require access. Haven't had it up and running for more than 2 days but it is running great so far, no drops at all. For the average user this router is easy to setup and will accommodate most network setups.
customer_reviews.author: hank

customer_reviews.title: Best Purchase I have made.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for about a month now...and I have not had any of the problems that I had with my belkin wireless router with MIMO. The belkin would constantly disconnect from the DSL or Cable line and then you would have to unplug it and wait for it to reset. VERY annoying. This router has NEVER done that. I never have to unplug it. When I want on the internet...it's ready and speedy.
customer_reviews.author: SJC

customer_reviews.title: Satisfactory Wireless-N Router
customer_reviews.text: The Linksys WRT400N Dual-Band Wireless-N Router that I've purchased has been functioning in a satisfactory manner so far.... There have been times when I've had to reinstall the software to get it going, but that's not a big deal. Overall, I'm happy with this product, even though the dual-band feature doesn't seem to work at times.
customer_reviews.author: Maximilian

customer_reviews.title: A very good deal and works great
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router because I have a desktop, laptop, and an Apple TV and wanted something that would allow them all to run at optimum speed. This works great and I am only using one port for the desktop. I highly recommend it. The setup was easy and it worked immediately. I am pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: D in BK

customer_reviews.title: Great router!!!
customer_reviews.text: This router works great. I set it up in about one hour. I previously had a belkin N+ router, but this one actually has faster internet (tests done with speedtest.net). Also, with the belkin router we were having many problems with out kodak printer and networking it. However with this new router all the problems are gone, no problem whatsoever. For the price, it is the best router you can buy. I own a macbook pro which i used to set everything up, and my friends all own windows laptops. ipod touches also work flawlessly with it. Works great for gaming, and watching TV online. Signal strength is superb (two story house with wifi going everywhere.)
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: wireless router
customer_reviews.text: This product was easy to install. I purchased it to use a laptop & to be able to use a Roku unit to stream Netflix to my livingroom TV . It works very well & haven't had any problems with it. It stays on most of the time, doesn't get too hot. I've had it for a while now, maybe a year. No issues & no problems.........love it.
customer_reviews.author: CW amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, reliable, consistent
customer_reviews.text: We've had this router for about a year and it's worked great. We use the different bands for different types of devices. On a daily basis we have 5 devices that use it. We have to reboot it maybe once a month, which is no big deal. The security was easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I am not a techy nor do I enjoy setting up hardware or software. I hooked it up and immediately setup all of the items in my home. The Wii works great at 80-100 feet distance, I get service outside of my home and even at my pool that is approx. 150' from the device.
customer_reviews.author: LadyRedRider

customer_reviews.title: Great router!
customer_reviews.text: After years of messing around with Linksys (yes, I know that Cisco bought them) routers, I decided to replace the WRT54G at home with wireless N technology to take advantage of the video streaming possible with our new Blu Ray player. It installed easily and as advertised. Adding new pieces of equipment (computers, BD players) is a lot easier than the old G wireless, and there's no going back now. Can't imagine dealing with the old Linksys router again.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Native Son

customer_reviews.title: Buy an AC router
customer_reviews.text: Was an OK N wireless router when bought. Did not stack like older CISCO type routers. Replaced after 3 years with AC model for more coverage.
customer_reviews.author: R. Koons

customer_reviews.title: Good Item
customer_reviews.text: Ok. I purchased this item because I was tired of paying rent on my wireless router from my cable company. I was very surprised at the ease of setting the router up. So long as you follow the directions it will guide you through the entire process and it even made a security key for me. I am not all that good with computer things but this was really easy. So far it is working great.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff kaiser

customer_reviews.title: My new router is terrific
customer_reviews.text: I had a second-hand router, which allowed my daughter and son-in-law to plug in their computers when they visited me. When they gave me a Roku, however, and connected it to my old router, the connection would last through very short periods before I had to awaken it to its task, repeatedly. My daughter has a friend who is very savvy in such matters and he recommended the new router, which I promptly ordered from Amazon. When I received and connected my Cisco-Linkys WRT400N Simultaneous Dual-Band Wireless-N Router by Cisco, my problems were at an end. This is not only a very beautiful instrument, but is perfect for my uses.
customer_reviews.author: martyinchaz

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: The router works great - the only problem I had was that the CD it came with crashed on my Mac so called Cisco Customer service and they walked me through the set up which was somewhat involved, but it worked fine once that process was completed. I've had it for a couple of months now and no problems - Netflix occasionally stalls when viewing shows on my Apple TV, but don't know if it's the router or internet connection.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander G. Prentzas

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until it died.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely loved it until day 19. It just stopped working. Dropped signal every 5 seconds or so. Zero connectivity. I had read that had happened to others, but many loved it so much. I recommend you look for a more reliable router than this. There is a reason the price is dropping like a rock!
customer_reviews.author: JimB

customer_reviews.title: works great for me
customer_reviews.text: This unit works great for me. The unit is in my basement, and connects to two desktops. The wireless laptop is on the second floor, and seems to have good range. It was easy to set-up - just follow the simple directions. As of now, I have no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: an excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended by my IT consultant who set it up over a year ago. It was used first with our Netbook and more recently with a ROKU. With both devices it works without problems. The streaming from Netflix via ROKU is excellent!
customer_reviews.author: SnapDoc

customer_reviews.title: I have to say I love this router
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I love this router. It's now been just about five years and this thing is still working great. Connection speeds are faster than when I first got it and I have zero downtime due to the device. I know their are newer versions out and even though I an Apple fan I would recommend picking a Cisco router. They are highly reliable.
customer_reviews.author: T. Burt

customer_reviews.title: Poor buy
customer_reviews.text: Poor performance. Have to remove power and disconnect router to modem weekly or more often to get it to work. No idea why it stops working.
customer_reviews.author: G. Burdick

customer_reviews.title: It is a good router
customer_reviews.text: Pros 1. Can setup a dual band wireless network 2. Easy to setup 3. Faster access to the internet if you are using the higher band network 4. Sleek looking 5. Great for VPN connections Cons 1. I had been using the Linksys WRT54GS and it was extremely reliable. In this router, the internet snaps once in a while I would recommend anyone who wants a good yet reliable router.
customer_reviews.author: Debdatta

customer_reviews.title: Great Wireless Internets!
customer_reviews.text: Fast dependable wireless router with lots of extra config options. I've had this for over a year and it's a great device. The only thing it lacks are USB ports for a Network drive/media server ad/or a printer although I've found workarounds for these problems.
customer_reviews.author: Burgh Guy

customer_reviews.title: Simply Love It!
customer_reviews.text: This router was able to copy the settings of the old router so that I only had to make a few polishing adjustments! Have not had any trouble with it yet (purchased a month ago) - haven't even needed to reboot it since installation! Sleek design lets me put it anywhere. Provides more speed than previous router (that was also a Wireless-N) to all devices (PCs, Mac, Wii, Blu-Ray/Netflix, iPhones...). Very nice product and well worth the money (much less on Amazon than in retail stores).
customer_reviews.author: Eric H. Mayer

customer_reviews.title: Router
customer_reviews.text: This is a great router. Set up was fairly easy for a non-tech and would have probably been real easy for a tech. Works like a charm. My router is located on the 3rd floor and I get a very good signal on the 1st floor and it is really fast. I recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Nintzel

customer_reviews.title: WRT400N Wireless router
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Better range and speed than my Linksys Wireless G Router. Includes "basic" network magic software which made set up easy for me but I'm only using the router to provide wireless internet to multiple computers. I did not actually network my computers. The pop up I receive from network magic each time I log in asking me to purchase the "full" network magic software is a little annoying. I'm hoping it will stop eventually! Amazon had the best prices for this item both times I searched/compared.
customer_reviews.author: Upgrade to N

customer_reviews.title: Cisco Linksys WRT400N
customer_reviews.text: This router has been nothing but trouble since I installed it one month ago. I had to call their support line several times to get laptops or PS3 to connect. The tech line was extremely helpful but the amount of changes they had to make to get my wireless devices to work was unbelievable. Now the router is constantly disconnecting and I have to unplug it and plug it back in. In fact, it disconnected as I was writing this review. Find a different router, you can do better.
customer_reviews.author: Gary L. Mabrey

customer_reviews.title: wireless router
customer_reviews.text: works really good on the lower band, the 5ghz band not the best. seems you have to be really close to get the higher speeds. could be my intel card. look around before you buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: Linksys wireless router
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my daughter and family. They say they like it, but I have no first-hand knowledge. I have used Linksys wireless routers myself, and I think they are superior to most other brands available.
customer_reviews.author: Donald F. Mccoy

customer_reviews.title: Great, user friendly, fast product.
customer_reviews.text: This Dual Band Wireless N Router was purchased to replace my Wireless G Router. It is working very well and has extended the signal strength so I can work in the back yard on the deck. It also functions at the much higher data rate when operating in the normal, in house, areas. The two bands are selectable, one for speed, the other for distance.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Miller

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this router for a couple months now and haven't had any issues. I'm currently using both bands to run different devices simultaneously and it seems like my speed's have increased over my last router. Set up was easy, but then again I've set up routers before so I knew what I was doing. Haven't really tested out the range as it's just running everything in one room over. After a little skepticism and a bunch of research, I've been quite pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Danger

customer_reviews.title: Very good choice
customer_reviews.text: My router died after about 6 years of service. Checked reviews and this seemed to be the best of what I checked out. I've had it about a month and so far it's doing a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted one year with heavy and continuous use
customer_reviews.text: This has been the worst of all wireless routers I have ever used. I worked well enough but died in only one year. Crapola.
customer_reviews.author: Craig s.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing but positives on this router. It has been great for our home wireless network with 5 computers, two printers and a scanner.
customer_reviews.author: BVCOPE

customer_reviews.title: Good feature, not reliable.
customer_reviews.text: This router has great features but, it's not very reliable. I have to power cycle it every 2-3 weeks. It randomly loses internet connectivity and it's certainly not my internet as I have this router sitting behind a business grade Cisco router which provides connectivity to other resources.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Good router, but don't expect it to work out of the box
customer_reviews.text: We've purchased two of these routers, and while both work well, both were a headache getting to work. The first router would not work either wired or wirelessly; the second worked out of the box, but the connection was extremely slow. Fortunately, tech support from Linksys was very good, and the rep was able to quickly diagnose and instruct how to correct the setup. Once the setup issues were resolved, the routers have both worked great -- very fast and no problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: J. Borodin

customer_reviews.title: Weak signal, No gigabit ethernet
customer_reviews.text: Weak signal, No gigabit ethernet. DHCP client table still lists wireless clients as LAN (sometimes). Cool paperweight. Works for 1080p streaming to WD HD Live + Below average. UPDATE Also I have an issue with it where it randomly drops wireless G clients from the network even while right next to the router.
customer_reviews.author: gl128

customer_reviews.title: Fast, but unstable
customer_reviews.text: This router is nice and fast, and I like the simultaneous dual-band, but it's almost useless for any real work. Large file transfers over wireless usually cause it to overheat and lock up, requiring a power cycle. I wish I could find a router with this speed (8-9MB/sec transfer over wireless) and decent stability.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff Greer

customer_reviews.title: Review of WRT400N router
customer_reviews.text: The router is pretty easy to set up. However, I'm not getting very good speed because of this router. I'm still trying to find out what my issue is.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: It is good.
customer_reviews.text: I use this router to connect all the electronics in my house. It does a good job and I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to install and works well. No problems encountered after using this for over a year. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Wifey

customer_reviews.title: good router
customer_reviews.text: we've been using this router for 6 months for 2 connections at the same time and speed is good. It is really good , but it has a terrible problem which is , it disconnects with no reason and you need to unplug and re-plug it !!!! this is an annoying defect !!! for the price it has, it should be great router but is not ! other than that, i'm happy with this router.
customer_reviews.author: Rana

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Still working like new as the when I first ordered.
customer_reviews.author: bwb30815

customer_reviews.title: further your range
customer_reviews.text: simple jsut switch to this model if you are running a WRT54G2 or WRT160N and you will see some speed and range improvements.
customer_reviews.author: Arniceous

customer_reviews.title: vast improvement
customer_reviews.text: This router is a big improvement over the old on. Runs our Sling, iPhone, and Netflix flawlessly. Range is good - no problems connecting anywhere in the house
customer_reviews.author: M. Chase

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Set up - Seems to Drop Connection
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a Netgear router with this one in our home. Overall it has worked fine and is fairly easy to set up and manage. I have had multiple occasions in the past month where I have had to unplug it and force it to make a new connection with our Broadband router. I am not sure why this happens yet. It might be the new router or it could be something else. I did not have the issue with our old router.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: I immediately set out to install my new router and dreaded it as I had had problems with my other. (Same brand, older model) I hooked the new one up and I was going strong. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Product is a junk, I bought in 2011 and it works good until this year 2013. Lose connection all the time, I'm an IT guy and would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: onstar

customer_reviews.title: Simple, easy to use, and very powerful range
customer_reviews.text: Easy replacement for dead 6 year old Linksys router. Plugged it in, and was able to see it easily. Set the WEP password without trouble and was able to keep all the laptops running without any conversion. Did convert a newer laptop to the N network and found the range was better. Overall, very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Strevda

customer_reviews.title: WiFi device
customer_reviews.text: Item installed and operating fine without a hitch! Good product. The product is a Cisco-Linksys WRT400N Simultaneous Dual-Band Wireless-N Router. Tested across the long diagonal of my home and it performed just fine!
customer_reviews.author: Donald F. Linton

customer_reviews.title: Cisco-Linksys Wireless Router
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and it's worked great!! I can take my laptop outside or in the back of the house! I am very satisfied with the performance.
customer_reviews.author: Islandlife4us

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: We've had this wireless router now for five years and it has worked flawlessly with no problems
customer_reviews.author: Colleen S.

customer_reviews.title: Limited range and speeds....disappointed....
customer_reviews.text: I lose connection to the thing all the time, but I am not 100% sure it the router causing me to lose the connection. What I am sure of is that the range is not up to par. I had a D-link router which was a few years older than this router and I wish I would have never sold it. Range was never an issue with that router. My advice is to look elsewhere...
customer_reviews.author: rednrust

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless router, and inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: The router does everything it said it would do and set-up was a breeze for the most part. Upon completion of the set up, I couldn't get it to work as the router could not find an internet connection. I simply unplugged the router and the modem, reconnected the power supplies and it has worked flawlessly ever since.
customer_reviews.author: Remco Julian

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for some time now and it has been very reliable. It was easy to hook up and get started. No issues.
customer_reviews.author: John Palazzo

customer_reviews.title: Wireless Router!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my household has two other laptops in use and one computer was not enough. Great product, I have no issues with it. Thanks Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: J. Avalos

customer_reviews.title: Not much difference
customer_reviews.text: Had a LINKSYS Wireless-G Router before this one and I don't notice any greater speed, range or reliability. In fact the reliability seems to be less with more intermittent droppage. I spent an hour chatting with LINKSYS support and it was frustrating to say the least. If you are doing alright with what you have I wouldn't recommend upgrading to this.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID J BENJAMIN

customer_reviews.title: Fast and reliable
customer_reviews.text: We have had this hooked up for about a week now and we do see the diffence in speed from our old G router. We had a few hiccups with the set up but we can work through those
customer_reviews.author: Miltown

customer_reviews.title: Linksys wireless router
customer_reviews.text: Good product. I have had mine for 6 mos without a problem. Somewhat difficult to set up (could be me).
customer_reviews.author: AZ-JR

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this router for close to two years now. It still works as well as the day I bought it. Easily supports Xbox 360, Blu-Ray player, laptop, and iPhone all streaming video over wireless at once.
customer_reviews.author: ceeasley21

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed with this router. I was not able to get the 5Ghz network to work and the 2.4Ghz network dropped often. I'm using a Linksys wireless adapter (WUSB600N) on my laptop which is 25ft from the router. I spent 3 hours on the phone with Linksys tech support. They had me try every possible combination of settings but never got it to work. I hate to be a downer but this was a big waste of my time.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall Hull

customer_reviews.title: Best Router Ive ever used / fixes self assigned ip address prob
customer_reviews.text: I used to own a Belkin router but it never really worked well with Mac.... If you own a mac and have a self assigned IP address problem get this Router.... Super easy to set up, range is great and my Mac connects faster than it ever did with no interuption of connection..... I freaking love this Router
customer_reviews.author: Gamble03

customer_reviews.title: Works great with our Roku xds...
customer_reviews.text: Easy set-up, streams Netflix in 1080p to our Roku xds box with no problem, and it's good looking. Really what more can you ask of a wire-less router?
customer_reviews.author: jw

customer_reviews.title: Best Yet
customer_reviews.text: I have used Ciscos' Linksys routers for years. I decided to upgrade to a wireless-N router (from G) and reviewed currently available products, both Linksys & others. I think I made the right choice with the WRT400N Dual Band. We have a Vista 32-bit desktop, Vista 64-bit desktop, an XP desktop and an XP notebook at varied locations about the household. However, the setup of a secured system couldn't have been simpler or faster and we run/edit videos, download utilities & updates, play games, etc. simulaneously with no interference.
customer_reviews.author: George E. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Cisco WRT400N
customer_reviews.text: The router was easy to setup and also to employ the security settings. I no longer have a problem with messing with antennas to get good reception.
customer_reviews.author: Chester F. Willey

customer_reviews.title: Router dual band
customer_reviews.text: Product works fine did take a litle time to set up network but after a few hours of searching it worked out just fine
customer_reviews.author: Pete Kelleher

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my first wireless router.
customer_reviews.text: This was my first wireless router so I wasn't sure how the process would work out. I have to say that this product was insanely easy to set up and start using. I don't know why I always get amazed when a product works the way it is supposed to on the first try but I do. I'm very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Scharfman

customer_reviews.title: top notch
customer_reviews.text: Great wireless router that includes two different radios. I did not encounter any difficulties while setting up and putting it into use.
customer_reviews.author: Luis M. Ceron

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Simple setup. Bloatware comes with the installation CD which can be simply removed after setup. No complaints about range or speed. Overall a satisfactory product.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Cisco-Linksys WRT400N Wireless Router
customer_reviews.text: I have always had great service with Linksys products. The product utilizes the same configuration look and feel as the G-Wireless Router I had and was an easy upgrade to my home network. It provided higher speeds and better coverage.
customer_reviews.author: steve-c

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I was working with a G router before and was wondering was my speed was soooo slow. Upon upgrading to this router I've had no issues with both my PC and the Xbox 360 connections!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie L. Pax

customer_reviews.title: Works and was easy set-up.
customer_reviews.text: Followed the directions and set up was easy. Rebooted the modem and the rest was follow the promps. Girlfriend can now play games on the laptop down stairs, signal is geat.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: It works like I would expect it to.
customer_reviews.text: It does the job well. It has maintained providing strong signals throughout the entire house. My wife can be on the internet as well and the speed still holds up great. A great product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Rein

customer_reviews.title: Bad range
customer_reviews.text: Bad range! Two bars and that has never happened from any other router. Returned to Amazon and they were amazingly fast with the credit.
customer_reviews.author: Annabelle

customer_reviews.title: Cisco-Linksys WRT400N
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a previous Linksys router to the Cisco-Linksys WRT400N and found it easy to setup. I was running with the new router within 15 minutes and found it to be extremely faster than my old one.
customer_reviews.author: joet

customer_reviews.title: Cisco means quality.
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality router. More then three years there is no problem at all. So don't waste for other brand.
customer_reviews.author: shakil Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this router. So much better than my last router. I would recommend this router to anyone who in the market for a router
customer_reviews.author: Billy Figueroa

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. I can watch netflix through my Wii on my tv now. Takes about 30 seconds to load movie, then plays continuously to the end.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: I got what I paid for! But it was on sale!
customer_reviews.text: After I had physically setup the router, it was a bit cumbersome to setup each computer and device. After the whole setup, it was better peace of mind!
customer_reviews.author: Meowmix

customer_reviews.title: WRT400N
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was a refurbished unit from Electronic Direct the setup was user friendly and within 15 minutes all my networked pc's where connected using the duel band feature and security, the cd includes network magic by Cisco which I didnt use I have my own registerd version of network magic.The pro's ease of setup and reliability, I haven't experienced any cons so far
customer_reviews.author: B.Knight

customer_reviews.title: so so
customer_reviews.text: as routers go its a middle of the road unit. not to user friendly or easy to set up. range is average. i would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: T.M.

customer_reviews.title: It works well & i'm keeping it!
customer_reviews.text: I was able to set this up with the instructions, very easily. It works whether I am near it, or upstairs in another room. Others are able to login while in my house & the speed is not slowed down. While it is not very very high speed, it is more rapid than dial up...and that's good! I recommend it if you are a general PC/MAC wireless user, and are not in need of hi-tech equipment. I am able to listen to music, watch videos, view emails, etc. The basics. Overall, i'm happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: great item very pleased
customer_reviews.text: This item works wonderful in a house with a desktop, laptop, xbox 360, and a wii. It was very easy to setup.
customer_reviews.author: Angelmom

customer_reviews.title: not work at all
customer_reviews.text: this Router never work!! keep rebooting... and I dont know what I can do about it I did Reset and still dont work. Regards, HR.
customer_reviews.author: Huascar Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: nice product
customer_reviews.text: I like this product. The software did not work while I try to set up so I did the set up manually. It was easy, just google it, you will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: merova

customer_reviews.title: Was slow and stopped working after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an old D-Link router, assuming a new Cisco would be better. I was wrong. Set-up was fairly easy, but that was about it. the router was slower than the d-link and after 3 months stopped working. would lose its signal and the ethernet connections wouldn't work.
customer_reviews.author: joey@aws

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Play
customer_reviews.text: Was fearing the worst,couldnt have been easier,plugged it in and everything worked, good range thru entire house and hasnt skipped a beat in the 6 weeks Ive had it.
customer_reviews.author: AJPT

product_meta.title: Cisco-Linksys WRT400N Simultaneous Dual-Band Wireless-N Router
product_meta.description:
The sleek Simultaneous Dual-Band Wireless-N Router works in two radio bands at the same time, delivering twice the bandwidth for smooth high-definition video, lag free gaming, and uninterrupted music in one band, while browsing the Internet, sharing files, sending e-mail, and printing in the other. Wireless-N gives you incredible speed and range in both bands, while the 4 built-in Fast Ethernet ports connect your wired devices.

AMAZON.COM
feature_bullets: High-performance simultaneous dual-band Wireless-N router for connecting wired and wireless devices
Simultaneous Wireless-N technology for unsurpassed performance, great range, and reduced dead spots
Four 10/100 Ethernet ports for connecting wired devices, such as computers, printers, and more
128-Bit wireless encryption and SPI firewall for air-tight security
Measures 8.07 x 1.38 x 6.3 inches and weighs 1.01 pounds; It's backed by a 1-year limited warranty

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars241 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
